intro: Kitagawia pilifera, commonly known as the silkyleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features slender, hairy stems and leaves with a soft, silky texture. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Kitagawia pilifera is often found in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and in open woodlands.
